alert.note: Alert for Bates; Vernon (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 25 at 8:25PM CDT until further notice by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Springfield MO has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Missouri... Osage River near Schell City affecting Vernon and Bates Counties. For the Osage River Basin...including Schell City, Taberville... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD WATCH... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Osage River near Schell City. * WHEN...From Thursday morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 32.0 feet, flood waters impact all of the low lying areas in the Schell Osage Conservation Area as well as several county roads west of Schell City. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 27.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow morning and continue rising to a crest of 31.9 feet early Friday afternoon. - Flood stage is 30.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 31.9 feet on 08/10/2013. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday evening at 830 PM CDT.
